item.description:
A "bonus game," solitaire-only covering Operations Leopard and Bonite in 1978. In that year, rebels in Katanga attacked copper mines around Kolwezi, taking hostages in the bargain. France sent in the Foreign Legion (represented by the player) to drive them out.

Like all Vae Victis games, this game requires assembly prior to play, and the original rules are in French.

name.value: En Pointe Toujours V: Afrique contemporaine

item.description:
Units are squads, Heavy Weapon Teams, and individual Leaders, vehicles & guns. During play, players alternate activating formations under their respective leaders, with each activated unit able to take a single action - commonly move, fire or move 1/2 distance plus fire at reduced effect. A variety of other actions common to tactical scale games are possible - break down/assemble Heavy Weapons, entrench, etc.

Infantry Combat is resolved on a CRT, with units being 'Stopped', 'Neutralised' (demoralised), Eliminated or losing a step. Anti-armour combat is resolved by a smaller CRT, using the difference between attack & defence factors such as penetration, armour, terrain, movement, range, etc.

Morale is measured per formation, with reduced efficiency (-1 to all actions, and must roll to activate at all) or even Rout possible after a certain number of losses.

from the rulebook:
"En pointe toujours ! is a game of company-level tactical combat. Volume V covers military operations in Africa in the second half of the 20th century."

Contains 3 scenarios :

 41-"Hélicos sur Béni Erda" (Helicopters over Beni Erda - Beginning 1971) French against Chadians
 42-"Blindés katangais" (Katangan armour - 19 May 1978) French against Katangan
 43-"Echec à Salal" (Failure at Salal - 16 April 1978) French & Chadians against Lybians




4 geomorphic maps, format A4 : map O, P, Q and R.

Like all Vae Victis games, counters must be assembled prior to play, and the rules are in French.

Game published in Vae Victis No. 80 with Sauter sur Kolwezi .

name.value: Reels & Deals: The Movie-Making Card Game

item.description:
Reels & Deals: The Movie-Making Card Game is an ideal game for a mixed level gaming group. The game is suitable for ages 10 and up and has wide conceptual appeal.

Players start with script cards from the Comedy, Drama, and Action genres - these function like "recipes". Then they raise funds and compete in Bidding Wars to assemble their casts. Players choose from over 60 unique Actor, Actress, and Director cards. Each character is a parody on a pop culture figure and has its own full-color illustration.

Children and casual gamers will enjoy the art and parodies, while more serious gamers will appreciate the game's smooth operation and strategic elements.

item.description:
This is a "Roll & Move" game from 1973, published by John Ladell Co Inc., Canton, Mississippi 39046.

There are 60 Item cards showing things that can be found at a few of the shops around the board.

Each player is dealt 10 cards which they must get rid of by landing on the shops where their items can be purchased.

Additionally, each player "owns" three of the shops round the board, and can force players to draw on of their shopping cards as a kind of "rent".

Also, players may have to pay for parking permits at the Police Station, can get loans at the Loan Companies and the Pawn Shop, and get extra cash at the Bank and the Welfare Office.

The first player to get rid of their 10 shopping cards (their "shopping list") will win the game, as long as they don't have an outstanding loan.

A French vocabulary building game, where one player chooses one of the 400 tiles, reads the word, without showing the players the picture on the other side, and everyone searches for an illustration of the item on their personal game board. Once found the tile is placed on the grid containing the item.

A very simple dice game consisting of a wooden board, three dice, three pegs, and rules all kept in a small plastic container.

This game attempts to simulate the basics of tennis. There is a Serve Die and two Volley Dice to determine the outcome of given actions. Two pegs track the score while the other one represents the ball as it goes from side to side.
First children must build the board, which is a puzzle. Then it is a roll-and-move to get your frogs to the picnic in time. Some lily pads ask you to draw a card and follow the instructions.

name.value: The Amazing Science Fiction and Horror Trivia Game

item.description:
The Amazing Science Fiction and Horror Trivia Game is designed to test knowledge in eight trivia categories: Science Fiction Films, Horror Films, Monsters and Superheroes, Classics (Pre-1950), Actors and Their Roles, Television, Frontiers and Galaxies (Star Trek and Star Wars), Into the Unknown(print, music and other media).

There are two sets of rules. The Basic rules are the typical roll, move and answer trivia question rules, advancing to the winning space (Escape Velocity). Basic rules also include Regulations which add teaming, bidding, sneak peak, etc. based on dice roll.

The Advanced rules add negotiations for deals, trades and alliances whenever you land on a space occupied by another player.

From the Back of the Box:

Increase your awareness with the challenge of Innervision

A unique and exciting new board game that tests your knowledge with 4,800 questions and answers in six separate categories: Entertainment, Art/Literature, Culture/Geography, Black History, Recreation/Sports, Nature/Science. Sharpen your wits--learn about the history and culture of black people and their many accomplishments and contributions.


This game appears to be a Trivial Pursuit-like game but with a different board layout as well as score-keeping pieces. My set was without instructions but it could be playable with standard Trivial Pursuit rules.

The Napoleonic 20 series expands with France’s long-planned invasion of England finally launched! With only modest complexity and a focused scope employing low unit density on the map (20 pieces or less) and dramatic, fast playing turns, it is the addition of ‘story-driven’ random event cards and night game turns providing the operational pauses and “friction of war” that gives players a great feel for the parry-and-thrust of a Napoleonic campaign as the armies close for battle.

With his newly trained and organized Grande Armée, Napoleon masses his forces in Boulogne for the great invasion. The Franco-Spanish fleet arrives on time to seize control of the English Channel, and a hell-for-leather landing is made aimed straight at London – the Kent Campaign ensues! With special post-landing maneuvering and naval conflict abstractions, Albion 20 adds many fascinating new features to simulate this campaign.

Will the Emperor finally triumph over his arch-rival, “Perfidious Albion?” Or will there always be an England?

Scale: Each unit is 1 corps, each hex is about 1000 meters, and each turn is roughly 3.5 day hours (or 10 night hours).

item.description:
Unbreakable is a game of futuristic ground combat for 2 players. Each player assembles a platoon of crawlers, walkers, and powered armor squads and equips them with nukes, stasis rays, lasers, and more. Then the platoons meet in combat where they unleash terrible powers of overwhelming destruction.

The game can be downloaded for free from the following website:
http://interformic.com/un.html#STATS

Game Components:
1 17" x 22" map
48 hex tiles
102 cards
24 counters
121 markers
2 player aids

You will also need at least 3 six-sided dice and about 50 coins or bingo chips.

Launch Fighters! is a hex-and-counter tactical space battle wargame available for free from the following website:
http://www.launchfightersgame.com/

Each counter represents a single fighter-carrying ship or a squadron of fighters. Players manoeuvre their ships and fighter counters to attack the enemy. Combat is decided by rolling a number of dice against a target number.

Advanced rules allow players to construct their own ships.

item.description:
WARNING!
May not be appropriate for people with weak stomachs.

Yucky Stuff Card Game:

This is a deck of 30 cards by Discovery Kids that was given out at Arby's with the kids meal. There are 5 categories: Strange & Ugly (Blue), Beetles & Bugs (Green), Amazing Body (Yellow), Body Bugs (Red), and, Dirty Devils (Purple). Each card has an item featured on it. Most of them are creatures like slugs or stink bugs (Hence Yucky Stuff). Some are body parts like fingernails or the stomach. Each card has great artwork and facts. This game is played like Go Fish.

name.value: Ripley's Believe It or Not! Did You Know? Quiz Cards

item.description:
Prepare to be amazed as you quiz your friends, family, and even yourself. These quiz card facts are stranger than fiction, yet each one is absolutely true. The deck includes 200 extraordinary facts, in four categories: Amazing creatures of the land and sea, Science, Inventions, and Technology. Fascinating people through history facts from around the world. Astound yourself. Astonish you family and friends. Learn some unbelievable-but true facts.

3 different games to play:

Choices (2 Players)

Risk (3 or more players)

Dream Team (4 or more players in teams of 2)

Essentially, the objective of the game is to be the first player/team in a race to move all game pieces around the track and into a home path, while impeding the progress of the opposing players/team through strategic interference. Players move around the board, using cards dealt to them. Cards are clearly marked with alternate uses, increasing the available play options. A key component is that play pieces can be coupled, allowing the top player to take control of his opponent’s play piece(s). Other forms of interaction include trading, uncoupling, switching control, and sending an opponent back to start again.

The White House is up for grabs!!

It’ll take more than kissing babies and a silver tongue to win the White House as rival parties face off in this classic strategy game. You'll need all your party members aligned and in sync as you march to 1600 Pennsylvania Ave.

• Can you keep your campaign manager on board?
• Can you out-spin the Spin Doctors?
• Will your outspoken celebrity backers help or hurt your cause?
• Can your Secret Service protect your secrets and service your interests?

You'll need to run one heck of a campaign to capture the ultimate prize...

item.description:
The Video Observation Game.

Players divide into teams.
Players watch a short video clip and are then asked a series of ten questions about what they have just seen and heard.

From Back Of Box - "The observation game based on 20 humorous clips with 160 question cards. The clips are so funny you will forget to remember the details! So simple it's fun for all ages and any number of people!!"

Few shipping routes connected the Soviet Union to its western allies. One ran through Murmansk in the far north, kept ice-free by the Gulf Stream and built during the First World War for the express purpose of receiving military supplies from Britain and the United States. In June 1941, two German mountain divisions crossed the border from Finland, intent on capturing the port and sealing off this vital access. After fierce fighting along the Litsa River, the offensive finally failed in the face of fierce resistance by the Red Army and Navy and workers’ militia units.

In 1944, the Red Army returned the favor, with a lightning offensive spearheaded by elite light infantry and aimed at capturing Finland’s ice-free port of Petsamo and occupying northern Norway. The Soviets rolled back the Germans into Norway, crushing the Army of Lappland and closing the war's Arctic front.

Army of Lappland covers both of these campaigns, both the 1941 and 1942 battles in front of Murmansk and the 1944 counter-offensive. The game system is the same as that used in Tiger of Malaya, and in our long out-of-print Blood on the Snow. Units are mostly battalions, with the maps covering the area along the coast of the Arctic Ocean from Kirkenes in Norway to Murmansk at a scale of two kilometers per hex.

Components: 

 1,120 1/2-inch playing pieces
 Two maps




(from Avalanche Press website)

Kickmazu! is a soccer card game for 2 players. It was released by a German chocolate manufacturer. You had to swap collector points for this game.

Both player get 8 cards representing one goalie and 7 fielders. Every fielder has on opponent fielder for a tackle.
Every time a player wins a tackle the ball rolls to the next row towards the goalie. If he wins a tackle against the opponent goalie he scores a goal.

"Board & card game for 2 players. WWII East Front very abstract simulation. Each figure (unit) represents an army or armored division. One player is the Germans, the other is the Russians (Soviets). Victory: Destroy all opposing units."

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the units. The German player has eight units (three Armor and five Infantry) and the Russian player has sixteen (four Armor and twelve Infantry.)

A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw hands of cards from a common deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, and defend.

Optional rules provide for an alternate German victory (the capture of Moscow) and Summer/Winter Offensive effects.

Revenge of the B-Movie is a fast playing card game for 3-6 players from 'The Giant Brain' and plays in about 30 minutes.

Each card in the game has part of a movie title, like 'Cheerleaders' or 'Vampire', on it and falls into one of 6 types; 'Connection','Monster','Make-up','Special Effects','Finale' and 'Intro'. Each card also has a positive or negative cult value in the top right hand corner and perhaps and edit, that can change the cult value under certain conditions, in the bottom right hand corner.

The game progresses in a series of rounds consisting of a 'creation' phase and a 'selling' phase.

During the creation phase players are dealt cards and build film titles, playing cards into their own films as well as those of other players. After playing any card they can wrap one of their own films to stop people playing cards into it, including themselves.

During the selling phase players take it in turns to roll for each of their wrapped films, trying to get under the cult value on a d6. If they succeed they get an amount of money dependent on the cult value and length of the film. The first player to a given amount of money, dependent on the number of players, is the winner.

item.description: Educational game for teaching children consonants by having them use alliteration to form adjective/noun word pairs.

Each player has an individual pad of paper with a 6x6 grid, with help areas around. This grid will be filled with letters, and all players will use the same set of letters. The aim is to create as many and as long words as possible, with big increases in points for longer words (number of points equals squared word length).

On your turn you roll 4 x d20 dice (custom ones, with letters + wildcard). You can pick three to roll again, then two out of those three to roll again, and finally a single one out of the last two for a final roll. Each die has a different distribution of letters on the sides (overview included), so if you need an "F" to complete a word, you need to roll the dice that have at least one side with "F", but might keep a die with a letter you have use for in another spot. After rolling you choose one die, the letter on its top side must immediately be written by each player in their respective grid.

When the grid is full (36 turns, all become full at the same time), calculate points. The player with the most points wins.

Some advanced rules with a timer are also included. The intention is to limit thinking time = waiting time to 30 seconds, and while doing so it adds an extra edge of stress to game. It can be used as much as the players like, from very aggressively for a speedy game to not at all.

Home Page: http://www.korso.se/

item.description:
A group of kids have wandered into your house to spend the night. Dawn will not come soon enough to save them, the only question that remains is which group of monsters will terrorize them the most.

In "Bump In The Night" 2-6 players each play a group of six monsters that they will use to terrorize the kids in the haunted house. If enough terror is generated in a person or if a person is forced to flee the house, the player claims the person for a point. Other points can be gained through special bonus cards as well. The first player to five points on their turn wins the game.

item.description: A trivia game where you roll you're category by rolling a special die. If you're answer is correct you note it on a grid. If you got four answers on a row on the grid you win.

"Each player controls a militia group in a region undergoing civil war. Victory: Reduce your opponent to zero population tokens. Each player starts the game with 20 population tokens. (Members of their own ethnic group)"

The game uses a custom deck of card composed of three card types: Leaders, Units, and Events. The Unit cards are used to attack and defend, but Leaders are required for Units to be used for offensive purposes.

"Multi-player board, card and dice game. Each player is a Mob Boss trying to make money and rub out his rivals. As the head of a Crime Family you recruit Capos and Enforcers to do the dirty work and then you take your cut."

"Object: The Mob boss with the most money when the last card is drawn from the Wiseguy deck wins."

"Multi-player card game. Each player is a Mob Boss trying to make money and rub out his rivals. As head of the Crime Syndicate you recruit underling gangsters to do the dirty work and then you take your cut."

The game is played with a custom deck of cards, composed of the following nine types: Mobsters, Armed Robberies, Major Crimes, Crime Operations, Law Enforcement, Escape Law, Destroy Operations, Costs of Doing Business, and Hits.

"Object: The Mob boss with the most money when the last card is drawn from the deck wins."

"Players are Drug Traffickers smuggling cocaine shipments from Columbia into the US. Victory: The first player to accumulate $50,000,000 wins."

The game is played on a single track that is thirty spaces long, representing the journey from Columbia to the United States. Each player receives three pawns representing Trucks, Planes, and Boats. There are also three pawns (land, air, sea) for the US forces and three pawns for Central American forces.

Money is earned by getting pawns to the United States space at the end of the board. If a player's pawn lands on a government pawn, it is considered captured and must be removed from the game.

Cards consist of one truth and one lie on each side, cards are drawn and read aloud to the other player/team. If the two lies are identified correctly the guessing player/team keeps the card and continues to guess. If both lies are not identified, the card goes in a discard stack and the reading player/team becomes the guessing player/team. There are six categories of cards, play continues until one player/team has collected at least one card from each category.

"Solitaire card game. Unique Deck. Something to pass the time for the casual Grognard."

The game uses a custom deck of forty-two cards in four suits: Light Infantry, Line Infantry, Cavalry, and Artillery. Each suit has ten cards rated with Strength values from 1 to 10. In addition, there are two General cards.

The deck is randomly divided into two halves, each with one General and twenty other cards. One half-deck is the Allies, the other is the Enemy.

The game lasts for fie turns. After the fifth turn, the player's score is determined by counting the number of Enemy cards captured.

Designed by award winning designer Rob Markham, The Crusades Quad contains four of the most important battles of the Crusades, set in the time when western Europe was using its military might to expand into areas it had not controlled since Roman times. The Crusaders' goal was to free Palestine and the Near East from Muslim dominance, and restore Christianity's birthplace to Christian rule.

Based on the popular Royalists & Roundheads system, the game features an innovative, easy to use command system that recreates the problems of command in an elegant and simple way. Leaders are rated for command, initiative, and combat. Special rules reflect the abilities and weaknesses of the Crusaders' heavy cavalry. Each of the four games is complete in itself, and can be played in 1 1/2 to 3 hours, with the ever-present possibility of one side or the other triggering an automatic victory.

Contains the battles of Antioch, Ascalon, Acre, and Arsouf.

"Tell your own stories of crime in the big city." A card game inspired by the film Noir genre.

The players share a common custom deck of cards that contains six suits: Atmosphere, Locations, Help, Hindrances, Witnesses, and Clues. Each card is named after something reminiscent of the elements of film Noir movies from the forties and fifties. There are twenty cards in each suit for a total of 120 cards in the deck.

The rules call for "the meanest player" to start the game. The players seek to play six card combos (a "storyline") containing one card from each suit in the deck. The game ends when the deck has been exhausted. The player who played the most combos wins the game.

´Cuéntame, cómo pasó´, is a game similar to Trivial Pursuit where players must to ask the correct answer about the things what happened in Spain in 60´s and 70´s years. The game is based in a popular TV show with the same name.

The questions are based in typical things of those years, sports, celebrities, curiosities..

The game is in Spanish and the components are:
- 1 game board 
- 400 cards question-answers
- 5 counters
- 1 dice, 
- 1 rulebook
A French abstract game similar to Chinese Checkers in that you are trying to get your pieces from side to the other, and so are your opponents.

"Two player card game simulating the struggle between the forces of good and evil in Tolkein’s The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings."

"There are two decks. One player uses the Forces of Light Deck. The other player uses the Dark Powers Deck. Each player starts with 5 Quest tokens and 5 War tokens."

"Victory: The first player to have 10 Quest tokens or 10 War tokens wins. If at the end of a turn one player has 10 Quest tokens and the other Player has 10 War tokens the player with the 10 Quest tokens wins."

"Card game for 2+ players. Latter half of the Seventeenth Century. Players are European Nations employing Privateers to attack each other’s shipping."

"In this era, only about 20% of a Nations Fleet would be Crown property, the remainder were privately owned ships, that when they were not augmenting the Battle Line, were permitted to do Commerce raiding on their own."

Each player chooses to play one of four nations: Spain, England, France, or Holland. The custom card deck includes nine types of cards: Ships, Captains, Crews, Bases, Escorts, Merchants, Treasures, Defenses, and Events.

The object of the game is to be the first player to amass 100 gold.

Program 832 - Corporate Server ASD9 - ACTIVE - Message Encrypted


 Secure Wireless To Neuronet


 Program Start


 Cell: The Corporate War



 Cybernetic urban warfare. Corporation versus Corporation and a whole lot of people are gonna die.


In the boardgame of Cell two to four players' portray Corporations that build the Sprawl city with Sprawl Cells while fighting over control of those Cells by deploying Corporate Ronin and Hover-bikers. Neurohackers are also used by owning the Neuro-Net to provide advantage in battle and add points at the endgame. Control markers are used to convert ownership of Cells like in the game of Go. There are four Sprawl-wide Events that can occur which include Terrorists Nuke, Mass Rioting, the Nemesis Mecha and a Net Plague. There are also Black Market units that go to the highest bidder.


 Earth 2045 A.D. - The Story of Cell


Some say the holocaust was born in the bloody conflicts of the 21st century. Mass Corporations fought for market supremacy using armed soldiers and Neuronet hackers and the common person was devalued under shareholder rule. The robotic uprising was a reaction to this wayward capitalism... the Corporate War of the 2040s leading to communism.


 This is a Blak Universe product.

"Two player Card game simulating the stagnant Warfare
of the Korean War's later phase." Adapted from the World War I card game Attrition.

The U.S. player begins the game with 50 squads and the Chinese player with 100 squads. The players alternate completing a sequence of five phases: Logistics (draw one card), Artillery Barrage (eliminate a random number of enemy squads - with the U.S. having more effective artillery), Charge Orders (the players may choose to charge, or such orders may be received by the Chinese player), Defender Fire Phase, and Trench Fighting Phase. Certain cards may be played to provide bonuses in some phases.

The U.S. player must eliminate the Chinese infantry and hold the hill. The goal Chinese player is to capture Pork Chop Hill by capturing all six of the territory markers from the U.S. player.

A solo-play suggestion is included.

"Card Game for 2 players. Based on the video game Kessen: Three Kingdoms Style Chinese Heroic Fantasy Warfare."

The game uses four different decks: Good Leader Deck (for the Good player), Evil Leader deck (for the Evil player), Recruit Deck, and Action Deck. The latter two are used by both players. Each turn the cards from the players' hands battle.

The first player to win three battles in three consecutive turns is the winner.

"Board game for 2-6+ players. Each player represents a tribe a of Vikings."

The game is played on a circular track divided into forty spaces. The spaces are marked to designate different locations or geographical areas, such as Iceland, Greenland, Ireland, Monasteries, Normandy, Mediterranean, Novgorod, and Byzantium. These spaces are grouped into eight Regions: Scandinavia, North, Isles, Brits, Francia, Rus, East, and Trade.

As the players move around the board, they raid the locations in the regions and seek to establish settlements. A player who establishes settlements on all three spaces for a Region is considered to have a Kingdom in that Region. Each turn a player earns gold from settlements and Kingdoms under the player's control.

The first player to accumulate 100 Gold wins.

Leader 1, the legend of cycling, is a cycling race simulation by Ghenos games.

In each of the 5 teams there are different types of cyclists: 1 rouleur, 1 climber and 1 leader. Different tracks can be arranged with the hexagons reproducing different types of routes: plain, ground rise, mountain pass and downhill.

Every cyclist enjoys the benefits of a free base movement which varies according to his specialty and according to the hexagon at the beginning of his movement. After this kind of movement every racer can add a paying movement. Therefore, the race is based on the riders’ energy management: initially the riders are all inside the peloton, where it is easier to save energy, but then they will have to find the proper moment to break away to open the definitive gap ahead of the peloton.

The slipstreaming rule assures the simulation of the easier breaking away with a fellow, saving energy by swapping places. Cracks, falls and punctures make the simulation more complete.

Leader 1 has a simple yet fascinating mechanism: players decide the placement and energy management of their riders, facing all the elements of a “classic” or “stage” race.

Re-implemented as:

 Giro d'Italia: the Game




Stand-alone expansion:

 Leader 1: Hell of the North

item.description:
Morituri Te Salutant is a miniatures rule set for gladiatorial combat. It was initially published by Gladiator Miniatures but the current (3rd) edition came out from Black Hat Miniatures in 2008. According to the preface for the latest edition there are no significant differences between the 2nd and the 3rd edition of the game.

MTS consists of rulebook (either a pdf or a hard copy); miniatures, dice, markers (beads, etc) and the playing surface have to be provided by the players. The game uses six and twenty-sided dice. Miniatures of any scale may be used.

The game is played on a hex grid using pre-selected moves for each gladiator. The moves can be written down on a piece of paper but another popular alternative is to create separate cards for each move. The selected moves are compared on a matrix that gives the difficulty for a strike to hit the opponent. As the game goes on the gladiators gain wounds of varying severity and eventually the loser is either killed or begs for mercy from the crowds.

The game includes a system for playing campaigns where each player represents a gladiator school. Initially the schools own half a dozen or so gladiators of varying types (myrmidon, hoplomachon, thracian, etc). Over a campaign year the schools participate in festivals where they compete for the prize money but also can bet between each other. As the campaign progresses individual gladiators gain experience, die, get wounded, and may even earn their freedom. The schools use the money they earn to buy new gladiators but the unfortunate may be driven to bankruptcy.

There are 12 different gladiator types each of which has a different selection of moves. For example, a spear-armed hoplomachus has different moves than a retiarius who wields a trident and a net.

In addition to regular gladiatorial combat, the game includes rules for mounted combat, archery and beast fights. Multi-gladiator and multi-player combats are possible allowing team fights, last-man-standing games etc.

Some play aids can be downloaded from the publisher's Yahoo group. They include a pdf of a hex grid and labels for creating your own move cards.

item.description:
As the box proudly proclaims: "It's Not Your Common Game!"
This game was a promotional item for the Columbus Chill of the East Coast Hockey League.

Intro from the rules:
"Your group of three Chill Fans are at the Chill game. They were so excited to get to the Coliseum that they rushed out of the house and forgot to eat dinner. Object of the game is to move your three Chill fans from the start section of their color around the arena - through the FOOD STAND, to get all of their food cards, to the SOUVENIR STAND to get all of their souvenirs and get up to their proper seats before anyone else. At the same time, there's a hockey game going on!"

Barik is quick, large-format dexterity game where players race to move small wooden barrels into their opponent's playing area. Each player uses 2 small paddles to grip and toss the barrels through a central goal. The first team to be rid of all their barrels wins.

Jump Volley is a large-format dexterity game by Eliott Games. Players use an elastic launcher to throw balls into their opponent's play area. The first player or team to remove all balls from their play area wins!

In a small town, the farmers have to collect as many eggs as possible to feed their families. But in order to get the eggs, they must have a good memory. The have to memorize both the location of the nest and the colour underneath each look-alike hen. Playable in two levels of difficulty for both beginner and advanced players.

Unlike the classic memory card game, players are not looking for matching pairs. In this game, hens occupy nests but must always be returned to a different nest once their colour has been checked. Hence, the eight hens are always moving around the nine nest positions.

Also unlike traditional memory, the hens are not collected as the game progresses so there is not a simple endgame. Instead players collect the coloured eggs as a record of hens correctly found.

item.description:
From the back of the box

Do you like Treasure Hunts?

Grab your magnifying glass and detective's hat - it's time to travel the world tracking down a Mammoth! Transform yourself into a super sleuth, then armed with dice, a track, clues and a map, pit yourself against your fellow explorers as you search for mammoth footprints and discarded blueberries (our Mammoth's favourite snack)!

Each time you land on a square, try to guess where it is on the map. If you're willing to pay for the information, you can buy extra clues with special Mammoth Money. If you get the answer right, your collection of Mammoth treasure grows and your knowledge of the worlds geography increases.

Experienced explorers can play a second, even more challenging game. Using a set of quiz cards, you can launch a fast-paced battle requiring quick thinking and even quicker answers! Even if you don't manage to beat the competition, you keep the knowledge you have learned, so everyone's is a winner!

item.description: Tik: The Ultimate Card Game, is played like rummy, and scored like cribbage. A game similar to progressive rummy scored on a hardwood board reminiscent of a cribbage board. Player attempt to make melds of cards so as to move from the starting place on the board to the finish line, any losing points count against you and you move away from the line.

The player rolls the dice and moves, then he receives a question from a certain category. If the player answers the question correctly, he receives a ring with the colour of the category. When the player has rings of all 6 different colours, he can move towards the middle. When reached the middle and answered the last question correctly, he has won the game.

Maxi Tam is a fast-paced, large-format dexterity game manufactured by Eliott Games. Players use small wooden paddles to strike a wooden ball into their opponents' goals. The playing field is made of stretched cloth.
Go Foot is another large-format dexterity game sold by Eliott Games. Players use U-shaped wooden strikers to flick a wooden ball into their opponents' goal and defend their goals.
Pass Ferme is a large-format dexterity game by Eliott Games. Players use mallets to manipulate specially-shaped discs. The first player to rid his playing area of all discs is the winner.

name.value: Dear Abby: I have a problem, my boyfriend keeps playing your GAME!

item.description: First game printed under the Dear Abby name, allowed for up to 6 players to guess the response of the current player reading from a possible 3 answers. Has 60 letters printed back to back on 30 cards, uncategorized. Each right answer gives 5 points, the reader gets 5 points for each wrong answer compared to his/hers. Object is to get 100 points.

Game consists of 54 cards depicting quarks and antiquarks of the various colors. Players are manifestations of the Strong force soon after the onset of the Big Bang with the goal of collecting sets of quarks to form baryons and mesons to score points. Sorry, no leptons in the game! This is an educational game provided by a Dutch high-energy physicist to help players understand the structures of the fundamental building blocks of nature.

What Laura experiences when she visits her aunt has been experienced by almost every child - waking up in the middle of the night in a strange room. Nothing looks right in the dark - you try to figure out what the furniture is in vain...

It's a good thing to have a star nearby - Lauras star, for example, which has helped many children with the books & films of the same name. The star helps Laura overcome her fear of the darkness.

In the game, the children use a shining staff under a dark foil "tent" to find different items - and all they can see are the outlines. Additionally, they move Laura carefully from space to space. This is an innovative game idea in
which the children need a good eye and a calm hand.

-- paraphrased from a Babel-lation of the description at the Spiel des Jahres website

http://spieldesjahres.kiratec.eu/cms/front_content.php?idcatart=617&id=520

name.value: Capt'n Sharky: Abenteuer auf der Schatzinsel

item.description:
Capt´n Sharky looks with his crew on a treasure island for jewels. The players must find very quickly articles on the board. Whoever is speedy can pick up a treasure: if you find a pirate, you go home without anything? But if you find jewels, you get to keep them. But you must keep them by using a catapult?!

The game uses a small "centrifuge", some kind of magnet, and a 3-D pirate ship. It's a mix of memory, dexterity & quick reaction time for the whole family.

--paraphrased from a babel-lation of the Spiel des Jahres nomination entry...

link.value: Capt'n Sharky: Abenteuer auf der kleinen Schatzinsel

item.description:
2 to 4 children slip into the role of penguins in this dice game. The move from ice hole to ice hole, hunting fish. (So far, nothing new.) However, the game is filled with small tasks (throwing fish into the air & seeing which side they land on, for example) in order to obtain the fish. The game also has suggestions on how it can be used with a larger group such as a kindergarten class.

Contents:
• 1 wooden game board (370 x 370 x 10 mm) 
• 1 dice with colours / symbols 
• 4 penguin figures 
• 40 fish
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box

item.description:
By a deep ravine winds the river of the dragons. There's something special about this game, however - the river bed is filled before playing with approx. 1 liter of water! The sailing boat of the king rides on the water, loaded with jewels. The players slip into the role of wild river dragons who want to steal the jewels. The only player who can do that, however, is one who has his breath well under control. Players move the ship by blowing through a straw to propel it along the river... but other players can end the trip by rolling the dice. In order to win, one needs a good portion of skill and dice luck beside sufficient breath. A damp-merry pleasure, which is also good for adults owing to a play variant for super dragons.

-- paraphrased from Spiel des Jahres entry

item.description:
The meadow is scattered with multicolored blooms consisting of hexagons. Square black & white cards with simple pictures are next to the board. The active player turns over a meadow tile - and sees a multicolored butterfly! Your job is to see if you can make the butterfly wings fit the image on the b&w card - if you can, you get the card... and if you can't, you pick up the meadow tile. You win by getting the most cards.

If younger players (the game is rated "Ages 3 and up" have trouble playing with the rules as written, you can easily adapt the game by removing some of the cards.

-- paraphrased from a Babel-ation of the Spiel des Jahres site description

The small bear would like to get dressed. He knows what he would like to wear... the green pants, for example, with blue & red shirt and the pirate headscarf. Who will help him find those things?

Kleiner Teddy (small bear) is a set of four different games using the same components for the youngest gamers. They can build the little bear up from the individual pieces of clothes or have a contest to find the things he likes the most.

The game helps develop memory, turn-taking & recognition skills.

-- paraphrased from a Babel-lation of the Spiel des Jahres entry

item.description:
Rain clouds appear over the meadow (game board)... and from a previous rain shower, rain drops (small wooden chips) are on the slide, sand box and climbing tree. In turn, the children roll a color dice to determine which area they attempt to dry out. Then a card is drawn that determines which finger & which hand they will use to shift the drops. The children may cooperate and give each other hints. The difficulty is increased as players are forced to change fingers and/or hands by the game board.

This game helps young kids have a great time while learning their "right" & "left" as well as developing fine motor skills & hand/eye coordination.

-- paraphrased from a Babel-lation of the Spiel des Jahres entry

item.description: This game was produced in 1893 and only 10 copies are known to have survived to the present day. It is one of the most sought-after baseball board games. In the game, players "swing" a miniature baseball bat affixed to the board to strike a ball.

The Red Ants and Black Ants are at war! Each side marches from their respective anthills, ready to do battle. The mission: capture the opposing Queen! Army Ants is a simple game that can be remarkably deep. Setup is easy and play is fast, with most games lasting about 20 minutes.

All you need is a standard deck of cards to play.

item.description:
Domino Knobelspass is a competitive logic puzzle for 1-2 players. Each player has a set of 21 dominoes which can fit on each puzzle sheet in only one way; players attempt to be the first to solve each puzzle.

This is similar to Einfach Genial Knobelspass, but using dominoes instead of Einfach Genial pieces.

Designed by Reiner Knizia and illustrated by the incredibly talented Ursula Vernon, In BlackSheep, players try to corral the best combination of cows, horses, chickens and more while avoiding the mischievous black sheep. BlackSheep is perfect for two to four players ages eight and up. -From the FFG website.

There's a lot of randomness here, but also room for elementary strategy. Players make poker hands from two shared cards (figurines of ranked animals) and three of their own (these are actual cards). There are three such hands playing simultaneously, with players adding one or two cards at a time to any hand on their turn. When all players have played three cards onto a hand, a winner is chosen, based on the poker ranks. The winner takes the two shared cards (animal figurines), and new shared cards are added. At the end of the game, scores are calculated by summing numbers printed on the bottoms of the figurines they captured and some bonuses. The black sheep figurines are worth negative points.

item.description:
Players take turns traveling around the spaces of the game board, each designated as a mile post along a train track. The player executes the action of the mile post they land on.

If the mile post contains a switch, the player must roll a die to determine if he or she must continue along the main line or take siding, which has its own spaces for movement before rejoining the main line.

The goal of the game is to be the last player to reach a fixed number of demerits, or brownies, assigned throughout the game.

Individual spaces may assign brownies; require the player to draw message or job insurance cards, which immediately go into effect; lose a turn; transfer some of your brownies to another player; or go on vacation.

Landing on another player sends them to the Extra Board, where they roll for some benefit and to determine where they must re-enter the main line.

IDENTITY CRISIS! takes the well known Rizla game to a new audience and a new level. This identity discovery board game that will appeal to a wide range of people is informative, educational, miles of fun to play, and cleverly fills the gap between Trivial Pursuit and Cluedo.

item.description: This version of Monopoly is based upon the English area of Gosforth of Newcastle upon Tyne. The blue properties are now sandwich shops, the red properties are clothing shores, and the orange ones are now hairdressers with the locations of Go, Jail, Waterworks, and the Electric Company remaining the same.

Monopoly Malta is to be published in November 2008 and is to include 22 Localities from the Maltese islands, as well as references to local culture including village feasts and traditional Maltese life within the customized Chance and Community Chest cards.

Whilst Monopoly Malta is in Maltese, it does include full English translations to make it accessible to English speaking people all over the world.

item.description: A very silly board game published in addition to the Sam & Max Freelance Police Special #1

name.value: Einfach Genial: Wer zu viel riskiert, verliert!

item.description:
Einfach Genial: Wer zu viel riskiert, verliert! ("Simply Ingenious: Whoever Risks Too Much Loses!") is a tile game related to the Ingenious board game in that players are once again collecting as many points as possible in each color/symbol while also needing to score points in all colors/symbols in order to do well.

To start the game, mix all 126 tiles (21 of each color/symbol) face down, then turn three face up and place them in a shared pool in the center of the table. On a turn, a player flips a tile face up. If the tile doesn't match one of those in the pool, he adds all tiles revealed this turn to the pool and ends his turn; if it does match, the player can either end his turn and collect the face-up tiles before him and all matching tiles in the pool, or take another turn.

If you're the first player to collect seven tiles of each color, you win. (With four players, the goal is five tiles.) Any tiles of a color you collect over seven are shuffled back into the supply.

If a player has a single color with fewer tiles in it than all other colors and a tile of that color is in the pool, the player can take one such tile and end his turn; this rule allows players to work toward that final color they need, while also pushing other players to try to remove that color from the pool. If the pool ever has fewer than three face-up tiles, reveal tiles and add them to the pool until three tiles are available.

Einfach Genial: Wer zu viel riskiert, verliert! was later released as one of three games in Fantasy Flight Games' Ingenious Challenges.

item.description:
Another Sudoku game.

You have 9 stripes with 9 numbers on the front and 9 numbers on the back.

You have to put the 9 stripes like a Sudoku.

There are stripes in 4 colours. This allows 4 players to play simultaneously.

A new, twisted game from Jolly Games. There are only blank cards in this game. You get to make up your own cards. After everyone writes up 3 cards, the cards are shuffled and dealt. Take turns playing the cards which are even allowed to change the rules of the game!

Similar to:

 1000 Blank White Cards

Talking Traffic enables children to learn how different question forms are used in an enjoyable game play situation. The activities provide a supportive environment in which to help children develop confidence and practice in vital listening and communication skills.

Talking Traffic cards also may be used as an assessment tool for a range of visual discrimination skills including colour, size, shape and number.

The inaugural, stand-alone release in the HeroClix Alpha line, DC HeroClix: Batman delivers a faster-paced, less rules-intensive version of the traditional HeroClix game.

Booster packs of the game each include a fixed, Batman figure. The released set size of 30 figures is smaller and easier to collect than a standard release. A 31st figure is also available in certain boosters sold at Target stores, replacing one of the standard fixed Batman pieces with an exclusive sculpt.

All figures in the release are iconic Batman figures previously released with new combat dials for use in DC HeroClix: Batman. Figures are compatible with the existing Heroclix game as well.

El Mundo ("The World") is a 4 player game of backgammon from Alphonso the Wise's Book of Games ("Libros del Axedrez, Dados et Tablas") produced in the late 13th century.

El Mundo is a form of backgammon, played on a round board. The board is divided into quarters with each quarter having six spaces. Players start with 12 pieces off the board and roll three six-sided dice to bring them on. The first player to get all of their pieces to the opposite quarter and then bear them off wins.

Players sit around the vinyl play mat on which rests a spinner in the shape of a bottle. Spinning the bottle determines who will be the active player's partner. A card is then taken from the Stunt Deck and the active player and partner must complete the stunt in under 2 minutes. If they do so, each earn a number of points as indicated on their stunt card.

Some example stunts are:

With your and your partner back to back, cross arms and hold hands. Turn to face each other without letting go of their hands.

Perform a dramatic reading of the phone book for two minutes.

And of course a good number of stunts involve kissing.

This game was played at SAZ-Party on 09-02-2008 first time at the Nuremberg Toy Fair. Only 50 copies of special poker card decks were printed. Each Player gets 3 pocket cards and can trade them with the other players to create the best poker hand. Each Player is allowed to choose 5 cards from his own three pocket cards and 5 community cards, which are available for all players. The more players take part, the more poker decks will be needed (approximately 1 deck per 17 players and one deck for community cards).

item.description: Tam Foot is the smaller version of Maxi Tam by Eliott Games. Players are equipped with wooden paddles that are used to defend their goal and to strike a wooden ball in an attempt to score on their opponents. The player to score the most goals wins.

Tibi is a large-format dexterity game produced by Eliott Games. The aim of the game is to be the first team to propel all your balls into your opponent's goal. Players are equipped with unique ramps which are used to launch a cue ball.

Twin Flip is a large-format dexterity game produced by Eliott Games that borrows heavily from pinball. Each player simultaneously mans a set of flippers and defends a goal on their side of the board. The winner is the player who scores the most goals and hits the most targets. Additionally, the game may be split into two sections for individual play!

"Yours or Mine is a game of exploration and discovery for two players, each of whom uses a deck of cards to build underground tunnels in search of precious minerals."

This game appeared in the February, 1997 issue of Games Magazine. It requires a deck of playing cards for each player, along with a pawn for each player and several claim markers (coins, chips, etc.) for each player.

This is a collection of three Checkers variants that were published in the April, 1997 issue of Games Magazine. It requires a checkerboard and checkers which must be numbered 1-6 on one side. (2 of each number, in each color.)

In the first variant, a checker can only jump another checker that has the same number or lower. In the second variant, each time a player jumps he or she scores points equal to the difference between the two checkers. The third variant has players scoring point values of all checkers they capture. In addition, pieces that reach the final row are removed from the board and the owner of that piece scores its point value. First player to 30 wins.

This is a collection of four card games published in the June, 1997 issue of Games Magazine. They require a standard deck of cards, and one game also requires a token.

All four games begin by dealing out a 7x7 grid of cards, face up. Play involves flipping cards over, one at a time, according to rules which usually involve looking for matches in either rank or suit. The four games are:

Matchline - one or more players
Connections - one or more players
Saboteur - three players
Cross/Block - two players

This racing game involves the use of yachts that move at a set movement rate (no dice) according to the wind direction. Wind direction is determined by a stack of cards that can be drawn before moving.
The course is a game board which has a grid on it with a start position and three buoys making an oval shape course.
Yachts move in a straight or diagonal direction and can change course at the end of their movement. 
This game is made realistic by the strength of the wind, being able to raise or lower the spinnaker to increase movement and seeing who can get to the finish line first.

item.description:
In Lice (Les Poux), two to four players use their tiddlywink skills and a deck of cards to try to get their infestation of lice onto the other kids' heads. Enhancing the theme, the game includes two actual combs. The main thrust of the game is that you use a "pitching coin" to try to propel a louse from your kid's head to another kid's head. The cards provide and prevent opportunities to do this, or even cause nits to produce new lice.

Rid your kid's head of lice, and you win!

There's a problem in the kingdom! It's big, it's green, and it breathes fire. All of the king's knights are trying to protect Princess Sarah, but are they any match for the beast?

In this fun table-top bowling game, kids try to knock down as many knights as they can without knocking over the princess.

Generals Order is a Chinese-language CCG published in Singapore to expose Singapore players to the Chinese language and culture.

From the publisher website :

Generals Order is a game that simulates ancient battlefield scenario that combines Wisdom (devising strategies), Courage (deploying generals) and Calculation (resource management).

In this battle of wits and courage, you are the commanding general who leads the army in their conquest of the world. How to ensure victory, change the course of events or turn defeat into victory, is all decided by your each and every action.

CARD TYPES 
 There are 4 types of card-types in the Generals Order SCG

General (Character) Card
Equipment Card
Event Card
Special Card

General cards play an important role in the attacking of opponent’s castle as well as defending your own castle from attack. All General cards have its own unique special ability to assist the players in their conquest.

Equipment cards can enhance the strength of the General Cards permanently.

Event cards effect are temporary but the effect is far superior to Equipment cards.

Special cards are the only type of cards that can be used during opponent’s turn. They are mainly used to counter opponent’s attack or event.

Home Page: http://www.generals-order.com/

Stadion is a track and field sports game featuring 14 running, 4 jumping and 4 throwing events. Basically all the events are played by spinning a pointer and then determining the result from the appropriate look-up table: how many spaces to proceed, how long the jump attempt was, how many hundredth of a second to add etc. The usual sports event rules are applied as well, e.g. there are three attempts for each height in high jump.

Similar to: Kansojen Kisat

name.value: The Official Handy Game: The Game for Boys

item.description:
From the publisher:

Celebrating a boy's life, The Official Handy Game
